remarks: The predicate "is a trace-preserving endomorphism".  Similar to definition of trace-preserving endomorphism in [Crawley] p. 117, penultimate line.  (Contributed by NM, 8-Jun-2013.)
statement:
tendoset.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
tendoset.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
tendoset.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
tendoset.r $e |- R = ( ( trL ` K ) ` W ) $.
tendoset.e $e |- E = ( ( TEndo ` K ) ` W ) $.
istendo $p |- ( ( K e. V /\ W e. H ) -> ( S e. E <-> ( S : T --> T /\ A. f e. T A. g e. T ( S ` ( f o. g ) ) = ( ( S ` f ) o. ( S ` g ) ) /\ A. f e. T ( R ` ( S ` f ) ) .<_ ( R ` f ) ) ) ) $.
$d K f g $.
$d S f g $.
$d T f g $.
$d W f g $.
